page.title: 01Physical Description
page.content: The land is flat and gently rolling with the general slope of the land being from South East to North West.The soil is mainly glacial clay. One badly polluted main stream ,the{River Wheelock,}flows through the village.It does not support fish because of industrial and agricultural pollution.The other main water system is the {Flashes}.These are long narrow lakes formed when land subsided above emptied brine streams. They are slowly growing in length and width.They now run North to South along the entire Eastern edge of the block except between Crabmill and Green Lanes.The Flashes support much wild life.e.g.Swan mussels,fish,birds, plants and insects.There are about 210 manmade and natural {ponds}in the area .The number varies according to season
